pullRequest.body:
The `cdot` linter is a syntax linter that flags uses of the "cdot" `Â·` that are achieved by typing a character different from `Â·`.

For instance, a "plain" dot `.` is allowed syntax, but is flagged by the linter.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10042722009/job/27753788939)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10042722009/job/27753788598)

Thanks for writing this! I just pushed a commit with tiny style-only tweaks directly.
Looks good to me now.
maintainer merge
Looks great in general! Here's a first round of small comments: I'll eat now, and will return to this afterwards.

Thanks for writing this! I just pushed a commit with tiny style-only tweaks directly.
Looks good to me now.
maintainer merge

```suggestion
by typing a character different from `Â·`.
Given this is the first linter for unwanted syntax, what do you think about naming this "unwanted_cdot" instead?
Renamed it to `unwanted_cdot`.

Can you call this something with "cdot", please?
(I'm unsure how to capitalise names with cdot in it. I may give that bikeshed more thought after lunch.)
Renamed to `findCDot`.  My instinct would be to use the same capitalization for `C` and `D`, like `ZMod`, `EReal`, `PUnit`,...
Works for me!
Would you like to test a second kind of wrong dot as well, e.g. change of the wrong dots? (I was wondering if the wrong dot was hardcoded - the answer is "clearly not", but a test could be nice.)
I added another test, with `(. + Â·)`, swapping the positions of `Â·` and `.`.

Thanks! I had meant something else: are there other characters which are treated like a cdot, but are also bad.
Reading `Init/NotationExtra.lean` in core, the current answer is no - so this is fine as-is.

This is starting a bikeshed, but: intuitively, I would rather add this to `Linters/Style`. (This linter is purely about coding style, and not at all relevant to correctness.) What do you think?

I agree this starts a broader conversation how to structure the `Linters` directory: would we rather have separate files for individual linters, or are we fine grouping linters if each is reasonably short? (In any case, having an overview of all linters in some doc-string would be nice --- but that's definitely out of scope for this PR.)

I agree that this is more "stylistic" than "correctness", but the other linters also do not really check correctness.

Anyway, I am happy if this linter goes somewhere else, but, I also agree that this is a discussion that should happen elsewhere!
So I'll start a zulip discussion/propose a re-organisation in a PR? Sounds good to me.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add the `cdot` linter
